page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: { { {East Braintree is mainly residential and does not include the centre of the town, although there are some shops. The houses are a mixture of of new estates and very old timbered buildings. There are several streets of council housing. Included in the area are a swimming pool and leisure centres, and several playing fields. Small industrial units have been built on the outskirts of the town and Crittall Windows is a major manufacturing industry. Towards the Eastern edge is open countryside with several farms and a village called STISTED. The rivers Brain, Pant and Blackwater run through the area and there are pleasant river walks. There is a branch line Railway Station serving London commutors.
